title: India beat valiant Oman in Asia Cup T20
byline: World champions India overcame a gutsy Oman team to win the last group match of the Asia Cup by 21 runs on Friday and stay unbeaten in the T20 tournament.

title: 955 kg heroin, 1,422 kg ICE seized in 2025 raids
byline: Sri Lanka Police have seized 955 kilograms of heroin, 1,422 kilograms of ICE, 471 kilograms of hashish, 29 kilograms of cocaine, 13,773 kilograms of cannabis, and 3.5 million narcotic pills in raids conducted so far this year.

title: PT licence mandatory for public transport drivers by December
byline: All public transport drivers will be required to obtain a Public Transport (PT) licence by December 31, Transport Minister Bimal Ratnayake announced today (20).

title: Massive drug stock worth Rs. 16.84 million seized at BIA
byline: A stock of “Kush” and “Hashish” drugs valued at Rs. 16.84 million was seized by officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) today (20) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Religious and aesthetic subjects to remain unchanged: Minister
byline: Education Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya today assured that the current government has no intention of reducing religious education or aesthetic subjects in schools.

title: Ampara district motor vehicles office goes fully online
byline: All systems of the Ampara District Office of the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) were brought online today (20), marking a major step in modernizing public services.

title: SLAF Bell 212 helicopter deployed to battle Pettah fire
byline: A Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) Bell 212 helicopter was deployed today (20) to assist in extinguishing a fire that broke out at a shop on the third floor of a building at First Cross Street, Pettah.

title: BIA immigration computer system restored after two-and-a-half-hour outage
byline: The Border Control Computer System at the arrival and departure terminals of the Department of Immigration and Emigration at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), which was inactive for two and a half hours, was restored at 4.15 p.m. today (20).

title: Cyberattack disrupts operations at European airports
byline: A cyberattack at a service provider for check-in and boarding systems has disrupted operations at several major European airports including London’s Heathrow, Brussels and Berlin, causing flight delays and cancellations on Saturday.

title: Fire breaks out in Pettah building
byline: A fire broke out in a shop located on the third floor of a building at 3rd Cross Street, Pettah a short while ago.

title: Ranil proposes 1,000 joint opposition rallies, satyagrahas, protests
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe today called for the organisation of 1,000 joint opposition rallies, satyagrahas and protests, claiming that the incumbent government is attempting to establish a constitutional dictatorship in Sri Lanka.

title: Nalin Hewage says bank savings are ‘money for daughter’
byline: Deputy Minister of Vocational Education, Nalin Hewage clarified recent reports on his assets, stressing that his bank deposits include funds gifted to his daughter.

title: Minister blasts Irrigation Dept. over ‘illegal’ demolition notices
byline: Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe slammed the Irrigation Department for acting outside government policy by issuing demolition notices on settlements within tank reserves.

title: Police sergeant arrested for misusing suspect’s bank card
byline: The Matara–Hambantota Divisional Criminal Investigation Bureau has arrested a police sergeant for allegedly purchasing goods using a bank card belonging to a suspect arrested by the Gandara Police.

title: Trump to impose $100,000 fee per year for H-1B visas, in likely blow to tech
byline: The Trump administration said on Friday it would ask companies to pay $100,000 per year for H-1B worker visas, potentially dealing a big blow to the technology sector that relies heavily on skilled workers from India and China.

title: Russia still open for nuke cooperation with Sri Lanka, but won’t force: Ambassador
byline: Russia remains open for cooperation with Sri Lanka in the development of nuclear energy, but will not impose anything in this regard since it is the sovereign right of the country, Russian Ambassador Levan Dzhagaryan said.

title: Some SJBers attend UNP convention defying party decision?
byline: Several Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) members attended the United National Party (UNP) convention despite reports that the party having decided that only General Secretary Ranjith Madduma Bandara should represent it.

title: Dunith Wellalage vows to fulfill late father’s wish by excelling for Sri Lanka
byline: Young Sri Lankan cricketer Dunith Wellalage said his late father’s only wish was for him to become a good player and represent the country, a promise he is determined to fulfill.

title: Showers expected in Uva, Ampara and Batticaloa after 1 p.m.
byline: The National Meteorological Centre announced that showers are expected at a few places in Uva Province and in the Ampara and Batticaloa districts after 1.00 p.m. today.

title: US vaccine advisers abandon broad COVID shot support
byline: A panel of vaccine advisers named by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. on Friday said that COVID-19 shots should be administered only through shared decision-making with a healthcare provider, scrapping a broad recommendation but maintaining access through health insurance.

title: Former TNA MP Thanmanpillai Kanagasabai passes away at 86
byline: Former Tamil National Alliance (TNA) Parliamentarian for the Batticaloa District, Thanmanpillai Kanagasabai, passed away yesterday (19) at the age of 86.

title: Parliament kitchen uninspected for 40 years, Speaker raises food safety concerns
byline: Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne revealed that the Parliament kitchen had not been inspected by any Public Health Inspector (PHI) in the 40 years since the establishment of Parliament, leading to serious concerns over food safety.

title: Trump and Xi discuss future of TikTok in US
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he and Chinese Premier Xi Jinping approved a deal on the future of TikTok’s US operations during a phone call on Friday, although there was no confirmation from Beijing.

title: UNP to hold its convention today
byline: The United National Party (UNP) convention will be held today with the participation of a few other political parties, which are expected to express their well wishes.

title: Sri Lanka’s food production sees unsteady path
byline: Sri Lanka’s fisheries sector, crop cultivation and animal husbandry see an unstable path with some sectors seeing a shift in production for the second quarter of 2025 compared to the same period last year due to adverse weather and market conditions, according to the Department of Census and Statistics (DCS).

title: SL revises 2025 tourist arrival target to a minimum of 2.6mn
byline: Sri Lanka yesterday announced the revision of its ambitious tourist arrival forecast for 2025.

title: Wellalage returns for Sri Lanka’s Asia Cup 2025 Clash vs Bangladesh
byline: Sri Lanka will look to extend their unbeaten run into the Super Four when they face Bangladesh in the Asia Cup 2025 opener on Saturday (20).

title: TISL urges full financial independence for CIABOC
byline: Transparency International Sri Lanka (TISL) has raised concern over the failure to grant the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) full financial and operational independence, cautioning that the delay undermines its credibility as the country’s lead anti-graft institution.
